snippet.textDisplay: Mr. Handagote is pretty good, but for me the soul of the game is Clockwise Operetta. I listen to that at least once a week. This one here is probably my third favorite - there's just too much to love about Machinarium :)

snippet.textDisplay: Easily one of the greatest art styles in my eyes. Great sorrow filled music and light hearted art make this point click adventure one of the prime examples of how games can be art.

snippet.textDisplay:
I absolutely adore this song. it captures the games style and feeling very well and its my favourite out of the entire soundtrack.
to anyone who hasn't played this game yet, it's worth checking out, even if only for the art. it's an amazing game that you can even enjoy if you don't normally play point-and-click. the atmosphere is just that great, as demonstrated by this piece.
snippet.textOriginal:
I absolutely adore this song. it captures the games style and feeling very well and its my favourite out of the entire soundtrack.
to anyone who hasn't played this game yet, it's worth checking out, even if only for the art. it's an amazing game that you can even enjoy if you don't normally play point-and-click. the atmosphere is just that great, as demonstrated by this piece.

snippet.textDisplay: the smooth wind instrument that comes in around 2 minutes is just amazing
snippet.textOriginal: the smooth wind instrument that comes in around 2 minutes is just amazing

snippet.textDisplay: @larry89 The thing about this music, though... it has a slightly alone/creepy tone to it as well.   You can imagine walking around in a completely grey and brown world with very few "people" around... It just has a bit of a beautiful, yet unsettling feel to it.
snippet.textOriginal: @larry89 The thing about this music, though... it has a slightly alone/creepy tone to it as well.   You can imagine walking around in a completely grey and brown world with very few "people" around... It just has a bit of a beautiful, yet unsettling feel to it.

snippet.textDisplay: Ah... Video game music... Especially ambient video game music... It's just brilliant, I think.
snippet.textOriginal: Ah... Video game music... Especially ambient video game music... It's just brilliant, I think.

snippet.textDisplay: That was phenominal!
snippet.textOriginal: That was phenominal!

snippet.textDisplay: One of the most unique games I've played, I would even go so far as to call it one of the best point & click games in my opinion. Right up there with Secret of Monkey Island and Zack & Wiki.
snippet.textOriginal: One of the most unique games I've played, I would even go so far as to call it one of the best point & click games in my opinion. Right up there with Secret of Monkey Island and Zack & Wiki.

snippet.textDisplay: I love this game! If fact, the robot band song showed me this game, and i looked into it and got the demo. I loved it so i downloaded it and loved it. My only complaint is that it felt a bit short for a point and click game, only taking me about 5 hours or so. But that was 5 of the best hours ever! This is now my second favorite point and click game, behind "Where in Time is Carmana Sandiago?" I highly recommend this game to anyone who loves artsy game and point and click games.
snippet.textOriginal: I love this game! If fact, the robot band song showed me this game, and i looked into it and got the demo. I loved it so i downloaded it and loved it. My only complaint is that it felt a bit short for a point and click game, only taking me about 5 hours or so. But that was 5 of the best hours ever! This is now my second favorite point and click game, behind "Where in Time is Carmana Sandiago?" I highly recommend this game to anyone who loves artsy game and point and click games.

snippet.textDisplay: As soon as I saw the trailer for this game it was an instant buy for me. It totally lived up to my expectations, what a beautiful game all around with a fun story and gameplay. I loved the point and click adventure games from back in the day (Kings Quest and such) so this was really something special to me.
snippet.textOriginal: As soon as I saw the trailer for this game it was an instant buy for me. It totally lived up to my expectations, what a beautiful game all around with a fun story and gameplay. I loved the point and click adventure games from back in the day (Kings Quest and such) so this was really something special to me.

snippet.textDisplay: I really loved this game. So beautiful. Such a good soundtrack.
snippet.textOriginal: I really loved this game. So beautiful. Such a good soundtrack.

snippet.textDisplay: I also like how there's zero dialogue, only thought bubbles and even with just that, all the robots in the city had their own personality and story. A bit like the first Professor Layton where you end up knowing all the unique villagers.
snippet.textOriginal: I also like how there's zero dialogue, only thought bubbles and even with just that, all the robots in the city had their own personality and story. A bit like the first Professor Layton where you end up knowing all the unique villagers.

snippet.textDisplay: An awesome and beautiful ambient piece. It played during a great part in the game as well, for those who played it you might know what I'm talking about. I played it last year and it's now part of my top point-and-click games of all time, I simply loved it. I've always been of fan of post-apocalyptic, dirty worlds with ancient technologies and robots, stuff like that.
